page.title: 10TOPSHAM BOWLING GREEN
page.content: In the summer you can hear the soft crack of wooden bowling balls from our classroom. This is because we are right next to Topsham's bowling green. On most days, especially when the sun is shining, we can see the white uniforms of the players walking up and down the green. Some people even play when the weather is not so good; they wear white waterproof coats if it starts to rain. Most of the players must be retired from work to be able to play during the day, but some younger people play too. If you look closely at the grass it is really fine and looks like a soft green carpet. It is well looked after, we see the sprinklers working in the mornings. At four o'clock a bell rings for the players to have their tea - but we are on our way home by that time for our tea too.
